meaningMnemonic: Remember how 米国 is "America." Well, more of that again. With 米 representing "America" you can combine that with 兵 (<kanji>soldier</kanji>) to have yourself a <vocabulary>US soldier</vocabulary> / <vocabulary>American soldier</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
